author: Staff Reporter
text:
Jipmer doctors interact with women during an outreach programme at Bharathidasan College for Women in Puducherry on Tuesday.— Photo: Special Arrangement

Early detection of breast and cervical cancer would help women in seeking effective medical intervention. In an attempt to educate women, the Health Education Initiative of Jawaharlal Institute of Postgraduate Medical Education and Research (Jipmer) organised an interactive session with nearly 100 participants.

The second outreach interactive session ‘Early Detection of Breast Cancer and Cervical Cancer’ was held at Bharathidasan Government College for Women on Tuesday.

A team of doctors from Jipmer – Dr. D. Kadambari, Professor, Department of General Surgery, Dr. T. Chitra, Assistant Professor, Obstetrics and Gynaecology, and Dr. Sonali Sarkar, Associate Professor Preventive and Social Medicine addressed the participants.

The programme focused on creating awareness about early detection of breast cancer and cervical cancer. It helped the participant to identify early signs and to seek medical help at the initial stage.

Bharadhidasan Government College for Women principal Dr. Sasikanta Dash, social service officer V. Chitraleka, Jipmer, Aurocity Rotary club president K. Rakini Srinivas, Secretary and other Rotarians were the special invitees of the programme.
title: Jipmer educates women on need for early detection of cancer
